description: A lush, forested island in the White-White Sea above the clouds. It is revealed in this episode to be the missing half of Jaya that was launched into the sky 400 years ago by a Knock Up Stream.

keyEvents.title: Revealed to be Missing Half of Jaya
keyEvents.description: The Straw Hats discover that Upper Yard is actually the missing half of the island of Jaya, which was launched into the sky 400 years ago.
keyEvents.significance: Solves the 400-year-old mystery of Jaya's disappearance and validates Mont Blanc Noland's story about the City of Gold.

keyEvents.title: Shandia Launch Attack
keyEvents.description: The Shandia warriors launch their assault on Upper Yard to reclaim their ancestral homeland.
keyEvents.significance: Initiates the war for Skypiea, as the Shandia seek to reclaim what was taken from them 400 years ago.

statusHistory.reason: Currently being contested by multiple factions

description: A stone altar structure in Upper Yard where sacrifices to the god Enel are made. It becomes the meeting point where the Straw Hat crew reunites after their separate ordeals.

keyEvents.title: Straw Hat Crew Reunification
keyEvents.description: The entire Straw Hat crew reunites at the sacrificial altar after being separated through various ordeals in Upper Yard.
keyEvents.significance: Serves as the central gathering point where the crew can pool their knowledge and discover the truth about Upper Yard.

keyEvents.title: Campfire Celebration
keyEvents.description: The crew celebrates their reunion by cooking and eating around a campfire at the altar.
keyEvents.significance: Transforms a place of sacrifice into a place of camaraderie and celebration.

description: The legendary City of Gold, originally located on Jaya 400 years ago. It was launched into the sky along with the rest of Upper Yard. The city contains golden structures and artifacts, as well as ancient ruins of the Shandia civilization.

keyEvents.title: Discovery of the City of Gold
keyEvents.description: The Straw Hats discover that the legendary City of Gold, Shandora, is real and located on Upper Yard. By combining maps, they determine it's in the 'skull's right eye' as described in Noland's logbook.
keyEvents.significance: Confirms the existence of the City of Gold that Mont Blanc Noland wrote about, validating his story and the Montblanc family's centuries of belief. This becomes the crew's primary treasure target.

statusHistory.reason: Ancient city in ruins, now located in the sky
